question: In triangle ABC, angle A = 60°, angle B = 45°. If side AB = 10 units, find the length of side BC.

reasoning_steps.content: First, find angle C using the triangle angle sum property: C = 180° - 60° - 45° = 75°
Draw the triangle with labeled angles and the known side AB.
Apply the Law of Sines: BC/sin(A) = AB/sin(C). Therefore BC = AB × sin(A)/sin(C) = 10 × sin(60°)/sin(75°)
